TextBlock.Text: OKALIS: I cannot help but feel unnerved by this place. Even given the nature of the <color=purple>Bramble</color>, I cannot help but feel this place is... unnatural.
NESIA: That may actually be fairly accurate. My analysis of that fluid seems to indicate it is a potent toxin, capable even of killing sections of the <color=purple>Bramble</color>.

NESIA: Based on our observations and the stories of the Dree, the nature of the Bramble is not like other plants. Where other plants spread seeds to propagate offspring, our thorny friend spreads seeds to propagate itself. This node, however, seems to exist in direct contradiction to that.

NESIA: In short, this node is another Bramble. This is visible not just in its continued production of the toxin, but also in how the rest of the Bramble is starving it. The implications of this are... unclear, but we should certainly study this plant.
SENNETTI: I also have that feeling, Okalis. Something here feels definitively different from other locations in this plant.
SENNETTI: Why would a node capable of producing such a toxin even develop?
NESIA: It may simply be a random mutation. Still, if such a mutation can create a node that is toxic to the rest of the plant, who knows what other mutations could exist.
